Docs.summary: Animates the value of a <xref:System.Int64> property between two target values using linear interpolation over a specified <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration%2A>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An animation updates the value of a property over a period of time. An animation effect can be subtle, such as moving a <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Shape> a few pixels left and right, or dramatic, such as enlarging an object to 200 times its original size while spinning it and changing its color. To create an animation in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], you associate an animation with an object's property value.
## Target Values The Int64Animation class creates a transition between two target values. To set its target values, use its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.From%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.To%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.By%2A> properties. The following table summarizes how the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.From%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.To%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.By%2A> properties may be used together or separately to determine an animation's target values.
|Properties specified|Resulting behavior| |--------------------------|------------------------| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.From%2A>|The animation progresses from the value specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.From%2A> property to the base value of the property being animated or to a previous animation's output value, depending on how the previous animation is configured.| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.From%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.To%2A>|The animation progresses from the value specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.From%2A> property to the value specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.To%2A> property.| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.From%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.By%2A>|The animation progresses from the value specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.From%2A> property to the value specified by the sum of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.From%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.By%2A> properties.| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.To%2A>|The animation progresses from the animated property's base value or a previous animation's output value to the value specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.To%2A> property.| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.By%2A>|The animation progresses from the base value of the property being animated or a previous animation's output value to the sum of that value and the value specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.By%2A> property.|
> [!NOTE] > If you set both the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.To%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.By%2A> properties, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.To%2A> property takes precedence and the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation.By%2A> property is ignored.
To use other interpolation methods or animate between more than two target values, use a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64AnimationUsingKeyFrames> object.
For information about applying multiple animations to a single property, see [Key-Frame Animations Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Freezable Features Because the Int64Animation class inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Freezable>, Int64Animation objects gain several special features, which include the following: they can be declared as , shared among multiple objects, made read-only to improve performance, cloned, and made thread-safe. For more information about the different features provided by <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects, see the [Freezable Objects Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that animates to the specified value over the specified duration. The starting value for the animation is the base value of the property being animated or the output from another animation.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that animates from the specified starting value to the specified destination value over the specified duration and has the specified fill behavior.
Gets or sets the total amount by which the animation changes its starting value.
Docs.value: The total amount by which the animation changes its starting value. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the By property when you want to animate a value "by" a certain amount, rather than specifying a starting or ending value. You may also use the By property with the property. The following table summarizes how the , , and By properties may be used together or separately to determine an animation's target values. |Properties Specified|Resulting Behavior| |--------------------------|------------------------| ||The animation progresses from the value specified by the property to the base value of the property being animated or to a previous animation's output value, depending on how the previous animation is configured.| | and |The animation progresses from the value specified by the property to the value specified by the property.| | and By|The animation progresses from the value specified by the property to the value specified by the sum of the and By properties.| ||The animation progresses from the animated property's base value or a previous animation's output value to the value specified by the property.| |By|The animation progresses from the base value of the property being animated or a previous animation's output value to the sum of that value and the value specified by the By property.| **Note** If you set both the and By properties, the property takes precedence and the By property is ignored. To use other interpolation methods or animate between more than two target values, use a object. ## XAML Attribute Usage <*object* `By`=" "/> \- or - <*object* `By`="{[x:Null Markup Extension](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)}"/> ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64Animation Clone() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a modifiable clone of this , making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
Docs.returns: A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property will be even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property was

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the easing function applied to this animation.
Docs.value: The easing function applied to this animation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Easing functions allow you to create a variety of specialized animation effects including bouncing, spring oscillations, and various magnitude acceleration and deceleration animations.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty EasingFunctionProperty

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the animation's starting value.
Docs.value: The starting value of the animation. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The following table summarizes how the From, , and properties may be used together or separately to determine an animation's target values. |Properties Specified|Resulting Behavior| |--------------------------|------------------------| |From|The animation progresses from the value specified by the From property to the base value of the property being animated or to a previous animation's output value, depending on how the previous animation is configured.| |From and |The animation progresses from the value specified by the From property to the value specified by the property.| |From and |The animation progresses from the value specified by the From property to the value specified by the sum of the From and properties.| ||The animation progresses from the animated property's base value or a previous animation's output value to the value specified by the property.| ||The animation progresses from the base value of the property being animated or a previous animation's output value to the sum of that value and the value specified by the property.| **Note** If you set both the and properties, the property takes precedence and the property is ignored. To use other interpolation methods or animate between more than two target values, use a object. ## XAML Attribute Usage <*object* `From`=""/> \- or - <*object* `From`="{[x:Null Markup Extension](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)}"/> ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty FromProperty
protected override long GetCurrentValueCore (long defaultOriginValue, long defaultDestinationValue, System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock animationClock);

.method familyhidebysig virtual instance int64 GetCurrentValueCore(int64 defaultOriginValue, int64 defaultDestinationValue, class System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock animationClock) cil managed

Docs.param: This value is the suggested origin value provided to the animation to be used if the animation does not have its own concept of a start value. If this animation is the first in a composition chain this value will be the snapshot value if one is available or the base property value if it is not; otherwise this value will be the value returned by the previous animation in the chain with an animationClock that is not Stopped.

This value is the suggested destination value provided to the animation to be used if the animation does not have its own concept of an end value. This value will be the base value if the animation is in the first composition layer of animations on a property; otherwise this value will be the output value from the previous composition layer of animations for the property.
This is the animationClock which can generate the CurrentTime or CurrentProgress value to be used by the animation to generate its output value.
Docs.summary: Calculates the value this animation believes should be the current value for the property.
Docs.returns: The value this animation believes should be the current value for the property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the target property's current value should be added to this animation's starting value.
Docs.value: if the target property's current value should be added to this animation's starting value; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the animation has only one of its , , or properties set, setting this property has no effect. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| > [!NOTE] > This dependency property is unusual in that the identifier field for it comes from , and is shared by various derived classes.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the animation's value accumulates when it repeats.
Docs.value: if the animation accumulates its values when its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehavior%2A> property causes it to repeat its simple duration; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks When this property is set to `true`, the animation's output values only accumulate when the animation's property causes it to repeat its simple duration. It does not accumulate its values when it restarts because its parent repeated or because its clock was restarted from a call. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| > [!NOTE] > This dependency property is unusual in that the identifier field for it comes from , and is shared by various derived classes.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the animation's ending value.
Docs.value: The ending value of the animation. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The following table summarizes how the , To, and properties may be used together or separately to determine an animation's target values. |Properties Specified|Resulting Behavior| |--------------------------|------------------------| ||The animation progresses from the value specified by the property to the base value of the property being animated or to a previous animation's output value, depending on how the previous animation is configured.| | and To|The animation progresses from the value specified by the property to the value specified by the To property.| | and |The animation progresses from the value specified by the property to the value specified by the sum of the and properties.| |To|The animation progresses from the animated property's base value or a previous animation's output value to the value specified by the To property.| ||The animation progresses from the base value of the property being animated or a previous animation's output value to the sum of that value and the value specified by the property.| **Note** If you set both the To and properties, the To property takes precedence and the property is ignored. To use other interpolation methods or animate between more than two target values, use a object. ## XAML Attribute Usage <*object* `To`=""/> \- or - <*object* `To`="{[x:Null Markup Extension](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)}"/> ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
